data.title: Our People | Meet The Team | Concept Companies
data.meta_description: Within our people, you’ll find a unique blend of talents across a broad spectrum of disciplines. Learn more about our amazing team today.
data.text:
Chief Executive Officer

Nick Banks

Nick Banks is the CEO of Concept Companies, a vertically integrated, multi-state, commercial real estate development firm located in North Central Florida. Concept, founded in 2004, has completed over 300 development projects totaling over 10 million square feet. The company is engaged in developing science, technology and healthcare projects, mixed use and multifamily, as well as single tenant retail. Nick a 30-year veteran in the commercial real estate industry and a graduate of the University of Florida with a degree in finance and a concentration in real estate. Much of his career has been spent as the CEO of Front Street Commercial Real Estate Group which he founded in 2002 while living in South Florida. Banks relocated to Gainesville in 2004, and in 2010 shifted the focus of the firm to serve third-party clients and perform brokerage and property management services. Within nine years, he led the firm’s growth to a team of over 30 professionals doing business in six North Florida markets. During this time, he had the opportunity to work with Concept Companies on several key projects in the Innovation District, where Concept recently was named co-master developer, and the Progress District, a robust life-science cluster located in Alachua, Florida. In 2019 Front Street was acquired by Avison Young, a global real estate services firm, where Nick served as Principal and Managing Director. Before founding Front Street, Banks was with Stiles Corporation, a multi-state, vertically integrated, commercial real estate development firm, based in Fort Lauderdale where he served as the Director of Finance and Dispositions. Prior to Stiles, Nick served as an associate director at GE Capital Real Estate where he focused on loan originations in markets throughout Florida and the Southeast.

President

Matt Cason

Matt joined Concept in 2009 as Director of Construction. After three years at that position, Matt transitioned into Director of Development. Matt’s extensive construction knowledge is an invaluable asset. He has a keen eye for recognizing key development issues in the planning phase complemented by the knowledge of how to properly resolve issues before they become real problems. He is a licensed Florida Building Contractor and Real Estate Agent. Matt oversees and has an active role in site selection and presenting properties to clients for approval and serves to ensure that projects stay on their critical paths through the acquisition and permitting/entitlement process.

Executive Vice President of Real Estate & Development

Seth Lane

Seth Lane serves as Executive Vice President of Real Estate and Development for Concept Companies. Starting his career in 2003, Seth leverages a unique combination of experience in deal origination, architecture, construction, brokerage, development, finance, and management. With over ten figures in development volume across a wide range of assets, Seth has handled commercial real estate development across various geographies. Charged with leading the firm’s development team in all facets, he is an integral cog in executing the CEO’s vision of building a best-in-class firm in client service, scale, vertical integration, diversification, and delivery of risk-adjusted return. Seth holds a Master of Building Construction and a Bachelor of Arts in Architecture from the University of Florida. | Member: ICSC, Urban Land Institute, Leadership Florida, UF Bergstrom Council, Licensed Real Estate Broker (FL). | Email: [email protected] Mobile: (352) 363-0136

Chief Investment Officer

Shannon Rex

Shannon joins Concept Companies as Chief Investment Officer after serving as Executive Managing Director of the Debt and Equity Finance group in South Florida for Colliers. Throughout his storied career, Shannon has been involved in the acquisition, disposition, and capitalization of more than $2 Billion in commercial real estate that spans over all asset types and structures. Shannon has had many roles within the real estate industry with his first introduction in college, where he served as an independent fee appraiser at Callaway & Price, learning the fundamentals of valuation. Shannon earned his Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration from Florida Atlantic University in 1994.

Senior Vice President Legal & General Counsel

Stephanie Burch

Stephanie joined Concept Companies as General Counsel in February 2022, where she leads the legal team that supports a portfolio of companies that are vertically integrated to provide a best in class commercial real estate development experience. Stephanie’s prior experience includes nearly a decade in commercial and residential real estate and more than 11 years in state and local government in various legal and administrative roles. Stephanie’s experience as an attorney in private practice and state government proved to be invaluable for success in her roles with the City of Jacksonville, where she led several initiatives that combined her background in real estate, finance, and administration to assist in reviving the Neighborhoods Department, creating financial assistance programs for families and individuals, and the City’s first Community Land Trust. Stephanie holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Michigan State University, a Juris Doctor degree from Florida Coastal School of Law, and is a member of the Florida Bar. Stephanie currently serves on the Board of Directors for the Jacksonville Transportation Authority and for the Jacksonville Community Land Trust, previously was a member of the Board of Directors for the City of Jacksonville’s Downtown Investment Authority, and was a previous Board Member of CREW Jacksonville, member of JWLA, FAWL, and served for 2 years as a Committee Member of the Florida Bar’s Leadership Academy. Stephanie lives in Jacksonville with her husband Chris and their 11-year-old daughter.

Vice President of Planning, Design, and Construction

Holly Irish

Holly completed a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering at the University of Florida in 2011 and is a licensed professional engineer in the state of Florida. In her 13+ years in the field of Land Development, she has worked in the roles of Project Engineer, Construction Administrator, and Project Manager for a variety of projects including small and large scale commercial, office parks, higher education, residential subdivisions, and multi-family housing developments. Through her experience, Holly has gained knowledge and understanding to successfully complete a project through the planning, design, permitting, and construction process.

Vice President of Science & Technology Ecosystems

Kyla Frye

Before joining Concept Companies as the Vice President of Science & Technology Ecosystems, Kyla served as Executive Director for the WT Enterprise Center. The WTEC is a regional business incubator, technology accelerator and coworking space in Amarillo, Texas. Her background includes experience in developing programs around entrepreneur support, strategic planning, marketing, operation management, coaching founders, and working with local, state, and national partners and stakeholders. Kyla holds a Bachelor of Science in Mass Communication with an emphasis in advertising/public relations and a Masters of Business Administration from West Texas A&M University. She is a member of the International Business Incubation Association (InBIA), and serves as a board member for SXSW Pitch and the Global Accelerator (GAN) Hubs. | Email: [email protected] Mobile: 352-440-9822
